posts.cooked:
We donâ€™t have a this.modules at line 173 though, instead we have SwerveModulePosition[] positions = new SwerveModulePosition[modules.length];

This line is under our getPositions function for our swerve modules, and the errors started appearing after we added private final SwerveDrivePoseEstimator poseEstimator =       new SwerveDrivePoseEstimator(kinematics, new Rotation2d(), getPositions(), new Pose2d()); in lines 82 and 83. We are updating this in periodic, but we donâ€™t think we initialized the above code correctly.

posts.name: Dan Katzuv
posts.cooked:
Snake51:

We donâ€™t have a this.modules at line 173 though, instead we have SwerveModulePosition[] positions = new SwerveModulePosition[modules.length];

I guess the error occurs because you access modules.length , which Java interprets as this.modules.length , but itâ€™s null . And positions maybe wasnâ€™t initialized until you called getPositions() .

If this doesnâ€™t help, itâ€™s be helpful to attach a link to your code.
